en.title: Fogón de mi Ma. María
en.shortDescription: El Fogón de mi Ma. Maria is a small restaurant located in Rosarito, Baja California that sells delicious Mexican food at affordable prices.
en.description: When designing this website I researched other restaurants' websites and took inspiration from how they laid out their hero section, menu and contact information, while simultaneously attempting to maintain the same brand colors and identity of the restaurant.
en.technology: This fully responsive website was designed in Figma and built using HTML and Sass.
features: Font sizes adjust to the users system settings easily.
contributions: Drew initial sketches and final designs in Figma.
Utilized HTML and Sass to build the website.

en.title: Izzy Davies Design
en.shortDescription: Design Portfolio for Izzy Davies, a Bristol born graphic designer with a passion for using color, composition, and 3d work to create beautiful narrative-led designs.
en.description: Because of the nature of Izzy’s work, it was imperative to choose a layout design that did not take away from her stunning graphics and instead used them to create a visually appealing portfolio.
en.technology: This fully responsive website was designed in Figma and built using HTML and Sass.
features: This website features an index of projects showcased in a masonry layout, a page for each individual project and an about page.
contributions: Slightly redesigned the original Cargo template and prototyped it in Figma.
Utilized HTML and Sass to build the website.

en.title: CZ Weekly Menu Website
en.shortDescription: Weekly Menu Website for Casa Zimbabwe, a student housing unit that is part of the Berkeley Student Cooperative.
en.description: The house provides access to groceries, an industrial kitchen, and daily hot meals to all of its 124 residents. As the person in charge of managing all of these food related logistics, I created this website as a tool to keep residents updated on what they will be eating each day, as well as providing them relevant food information and announcements for the week.
en.technology: This fully responsive website was designed in Figma and built using HTML and Sass.
features: I took inspiration from looking at how restaurants display their menus on their websites.
The menu resizes with the screen but never changes its internal layout, instead behaving very similarly to a pdf.
contributions: Drew initial sketches and final designs in Figma.
Utilized HTML and Sass to build the website.

en.title: SCMI
en.shortDescription: Web Based Self-Service Store Monitoring System made during my time as a contractor for Motus Guadalajara (2018-2021) in collaboration with Rycsa and Thermo Star.
en.description: SCMI (Sistemas de Control y Monitoreo Inteligente) is an online system providing managers of self-service stores with the ability to monitor and control the state of fridges and other components in the store.
en.technology: This fully responsive web system was built using the LAMP stack.
features: Fully responsive web client that can be accessed on the web or locally depending on the clients needs.
Easily monitor, control, and configure the state of the refrigerators and other components utilizing the web interface.
Easily monitor energy consumption and alerts utilizing the web interface.
Generate graphs, history reports and analytics on fridge use and temperatures, electricity use, and so on utilizing the web interface.
Access a detailed log containing all changes to the configuration and control variables utilizing the web interface.
Easily add and change color themes for the web interface.
contributions: Utilized Figma to design the user interfaces used to control and configure the refrigerator variables as well as the change log.
Utilized HTML, CSS, and Javascript to build the frontend interface.
Utilized PHP as a backend that takes care of templating, routing, user sessions, and connecting to the database.
Utilized PHP to create a REST API used by both the on-site refrigerator sensors and the client to communicate with the backend.

en.title: Restofácil
en.shortDescription: Browser based Restaurant Management Software made during my time as a contractor for Motus Guadalajara (2018-2021).
en.description: Restofácil is an online system providing service industry businesses and staff with an easy and fast way of managing tables, orders, customers, and payments.
en.technology: This fully responsive web system was built using the LAMP stack.
features: REST API written in PHP that connects the web client to the database.
Quick pin-based login system for servers and managers.
As a server you can easily login and see your tables, add food to orders, check and update the status of orders, and close orders out.
As a manager you can easily reassign tables, add food to orders, check and update their status, authorize changes to an order, and close orders out.
contributions: Utilized HTML and CSS to build the web interface and Javascript to update it in real time.
Utilized PHP to create a REST API used by the web client to pull information from the database.
